WRITING.TEXT: That's why we go in with HARM missiles first, get them to target our fast high flyers then take them out as soon as they turn on their radar. Problem solved.

I'm saying that if the US were to invade, not with the intention of stopping a nuclear test but regime change in mind, that it is entirely possible to deploy the MOAB. Yes it would take some time to clear the way so to speak but time is on our side, not theirs.
You said it right. It is not an option to let NK have a payload delivery vehicle that they can lord over their neighbors with the threat of nuclear attack.

It would be very easy for the US to establish air superiority, then follow up with radar seeking missiles to counter the SAM and AA threat. Afterwards a C-130 could deliver virtually unopposed. The problem would be how to handle a land invasion if it came to it and that is NK's ace in the hole. Hopefully, they will turn over their nuclear weapons and everything will be ok. China is pushing for this so hopefully it will happen.

I joined the military and spent 20 years traveling the world with my wife and kids. I'm from Michigan and she is from Texas so now I'm retired and live in Texas. Anyway, it would have been nice to stay by my parents but I had to get the hell out of there and go see some places. I still don't want to move back there and don't ever plan to. I have two brothers there and they can take care of my parents when they get old. I'm about 80 miles from my wife's parents so she is happy to be close to them again but we are far enough away to not go there constantly. I was fortunate to have grown up close to both sets of grandparents. I have lots of fond memories of spending time with them and my kids will not have the same experience that I did and I do regret that part. It is what it is.

Captain DePaul. He graduated from West Point and this guy was hands down the best leader I have ever worked for. It wasn't his raw brain power, like some kind of autistic savant or anything, but the way he could get a group of people to make things happen were something to behold. He was never an asshole or never used his authority or wasn't manipulative in any way. He was just the type of person that you wanted to give 100% to because he believed in you and was never disappointed if you couldn't deliver. If you got stuck on whatever project he would get the right people to help you. There is a saying that smart people surround themselves with people smarter than them and he had this down to a science. He knew all of our strengths and weaknesses and knew how to get all of us to work together and get stuff done. I haven't met anyone else like him before or since.

I joined the AF after high school back in 95 but I was never in shape to begin with. They never made us exercise after basic training so I got fat. I went in weighing 153lbs and blew up to 212 in about a year and a half. Anyways, I'd be laying in my chair drinking beer and smoking, then every once in a while it felt like my heart skipped a beat. That was my sign I was headed down the wrong path so I quit smoking and started mountain biking in 97. Then around 2003 they started making us do PT and I was so glad I had stayed somewhat in shape on my own. Now I'm retired from the AF and work with a bunch of old out of shape civilians with all kinds of health problems...I never want that to be me.
Call me old fashioned but try using your words and tell her how her behavior is not conducive to having a relationship and if this shit continues, your outta there.

Here is something else that CAN help you. So yesterday I prayed for you not to kill yourself. Yes, I believe in God. I'm not a "religious nut" but I really do believe that if you ask for forgiveness he will take care of you.

I'm on my way to work but I stopped so I can talk to you about this. So my friend Nick was caught up like you, from what it sounds like, trying to live up to other people's expectations. It was too much for him to handle and he was looking for an easy way out by killing himself. We talked it over and like I said earlier, his parents and school were stressing him out. Do you really think your friends and family would rather have you dead than uneducated? So Nick is now a truck driver and he loves it. Who cares what other people think about you, it's your life to live and not theirs.

My friend Nick told me he wanted to kill himself so I lit one up and had a meaningful discussion about life in general. He was under a lot of stress from his parents and school. He moved out and dropped out of school but now he is happily married and still alive.

Hey, please don't kill yourself. My friend Ross killed himself and I will never forgive him for doing that. I'm gonna kick his ass in the afterlife when I get there. But seriously, please tell your parents or school counselor that you are planning on hurting yourself. Don't fuck around and pretend that what you are doing to yourself only affects you. Think of all your friends and family that like having you around and who care for you. Let's say you drink some peroxide, yea it burns your throats and now you have to be fed with a feeding tube. Don't forget that you will be put in a hospital and on suicide watch where you won't be able to hurt yourself anymore which means you will probably be restrained on a gurney. You will be strapped down and your throat will be fucked up for the rest of your life because your teenage hormones were getting your brain all fucked up. Trust me, things will get better but it's going to take some time, it could be months or maybe a year or two but eventually you will feel better and be glad that you didn't do permanent damage to your body. I usually don't write this much but I am hoping that you know that you need to get some help and don't drink that shit. Go smash your finger with a hammer if you really need to feel some pain but then go get some help.
